statement:
Every symmetric polynomial $P(x_1,\,x_2,\,\ldots,\,x_n)$ in the
indeterminates $x_1,\,x_2,\,\ldots,\,x_n$ can be expressed as a
polynomial $Q(p_1,\,p_2,\,\ldots,\,p_n)$ in the elementary symmetric
polynomials $p_1,\,p_2,\,\ldots,\,p_n$ of $x_1,\,x_2,\,\ldots,\,x_n$.
The polynomial $Q$ is unique, its coefficients are elements of the ring
determined by the coefficients of $P$ and its degree with respect to
$p_1,\,p_2,\,\ldots,\,p_n$ is same as the degree of $P$ with respect to
$x_1$.
